meanings.definition: A large, densely packed crowd of people or animals.
meanings.sent1: The throng of fans cheered loudly at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The city square was filled with a throng of protesters.
meanings.sent3: The throng of ducks waddled noisily across the park.
meanings.sent4: The throng of shoppers surged into the store like a tidal wave.
meanings.sent5: The throng of students rushed out of the school gates at the end of the day.

meanings.definition: To gather or move in a large, densely packed group.
meanings.sent1: People thronged around the street performer to watch his magic tricks.
meanings.sent2: The excited children thronged around the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent3: The tourists thronged to the famous landmark for selfies.
meanings.sent4: The bees thronged around the hive entrance, buzzing with activity.
meanings.sent5: The birds thronged together on the power lines, chirping happily.

meanings.definition: To fill or be present in large numbers.
meanings.sent1: The aroma of freshly baked cookies thronged the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The memories of childhood thronged her mind as she visited the old playground.
meanings.sent3: The colorful flowers thronged the garden, creating a beautiful display.
meanings.sent4: The stars thronged the night sky, twinkling like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The sounds of laughter and chatter thronged the bustling marketplace.
